Title: The Three Faces of Eve
Writer: Nunnally Johnson (screenplay), Corbett Thigpen (book), Hervey M. Cleckley (book)
Actors: Joanne Woodward, David Wayne, Lee J. Cobb, Edwin Jerome
Plot: Eve White is a quiet, mousy, unassuming wife and mother who keeps suffering from headaches and occasional black outs. Eventually she is sent to see psychiatrist Dr. Luther, and, while under hypnosis, a whole new personality emerges: the racy, wild, fun-loving Eve Black. Under continued therapy, yet a third personality appears, the relatively stable Jane. This film, based on the true-life case of a multiple personality, chronicles Dr. Luther's attempts to reconcile the three faces of Eve. multiple personalities.
